Issues.Title: Clean up Capture method
Issues.Body:
CaptureInternal was only necessary for perf on framework as the public property asserted code permissions. Removed it and cleaned up some comments around the changed code. Also removed the unnecessary HandleRef.

Issues.Title: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Runtime, Version=4.2.2.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a' or one of its dependencies
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.1
OS version: win10 64-bit

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

**Problem description:**
I'm creating an app WinForms and when I double-click in Forms.cs after load extension winformsdesigner.setup.vsix, I get this error Could not load file or assembly 'System.Runtime, Version=4.2.2.0,  Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a' or one of its dependencies. 

**Actual behavior:**

Create a new WinForms App (.Net Core) with extension winformsdesigner.setup.vsix installled.

Issues.Title: Remove duplicate DpiHelper implementation
Issues.Body:
Closes #2120 

## Proposed Changes
- First we need to consolidate the various Interop functions (GetProcessDpiAwareness, SetProcessDpiAwareness, IsValidDpiAwarenessContext, SetProcessDpiAwarenessContext, IsProcessDPIAware and SetProcessDPIAware) allowing us to use the common file
- Then include the common file in `System.Windows.Forms.Design.Editors.csproj`
- Include the function `ScaleButtonImageLogicalToDevice` in the common file

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2131)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove duplicate DpiHelper implementation" (#2131)

Issues.Title: use httpclient instead of webrequest
Issues.Body:
Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/1756
Refactor `PictureBox` to use `HttpClient` instead of using `WebRequest`
Before implementing read comments from this pr https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1952
Introduced HttpClient field as suggested by  @RussKie  in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1952#discussion_r329871280

## Proposed changes
- introduce optional `HttpClient` parameter in `PictureBox` constructor
- use `HttpClient` instead of using `WebRequest`
- use `CancellationToken` to cancel request
- update error handling due to  `HttpClient` behavior 

## Customer Impact

-  may be a breaking change:  introduce optional `HttpClient` parameter in `PictureBox` constructor

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Low/Medium


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Run all tests in the solution
- Manual testing and debugging with test project according to debugging guide for various cases (success, unsuccessful such as remote server fail, non-existed image etc.)

 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->
```

 Commit:    04339c3a26

 OS Name:     Windows
```

Issues.Title: ToolStripImageIndexEditor should not be referenced in ToolStripItem class because it does not exist
Issues.Body:
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
Editor attribute decorates a non browsable property -

Issues.Title: Duplicatated `DpiHelper` implementations
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**

* `System.Windows.Forms` uses the common implementation of `DpiHelpers` from https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/Common/src/DpiHelper.cs
* `System.Windows.Forms.Design` uses the common implementation of `DpiHelpers` from https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/Common/src/DpiHelper.cs
* `System.Windows.Forms.Design.Editors` has own implementation in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design.Editors/src/Misc/DpiHelper.cs


**Expected behavior:**

`System.Windows.Forms.Design.Editors` uses the common implementation instead of maintaining own copy.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Duplicatated `DpiHelper` implementations" (#2120)
